titles.title: Government Reporting Efficiency Act of 2014
To require the sunset of certain Federal Government reporting requirements to Congress, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

bill.summary: 5/9/2014--Introduced. Government Reporting Efficiency Act of 2014 - Terminates any statutory requirement for reporting by a federal agency to Congress on the date that is five years after the enactment of this Act and every five years after such original termination date. Allows a permanent exception to such termination rule.
